intro: Oxytropis changaica, commonly known as the Changai locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly found in Kazakhstan and western China. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, compound leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale purple to yellow, arranged in small clusters, and bloom in the summer months. Oxytropis changaica is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
